loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, rice, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow and fodder

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is a married woman with four children, three girls and one boy, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rent bills.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a vegetable stall business where she earns her other source of income. Siti faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability of products in her business. She dreams of becoming a vegetable supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, beans, maize flour, and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, beans, maize flour, and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase garden tools, seeeds and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en:
Nurlan is a 23-year-old IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who engages in cattle breeding and milk selling. He has 3 years of experience in this field. He is not married. His brother helps him run the business. He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them, and then resells them in the livestock bazaar once every 5-6 months. 

He sells milk and yoghurt almost every day and this also brings him a good income. Being very popular, milk and meat products are in very high demand, and Azerbaijani people use them in everyday cuisine.  

Now Nurlan is thinking of getting married, and to do this he needs to build a house. He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to purchase another calf and a milk cow. He believes that additional cattle will bring up his income and he will be able to save money, build a house and get married.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow and one calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one milk cow and one calf.

loans.name: Shanitah

texts.en:
Shanitah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 1 child and her child goes to school. She takes care of one additional family member (mother). She sells soft drinks at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last 5 years. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more passion fruits and oranges. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business into a wholesale one. 

She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of passion fruits and oranges.

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen was born in 1976. He lives with his pensioner parents and his wife in Ijevan city. Vazgen’s wife works at the Ijevan kindergarten as a teacher. 

Since 1995 Vazgen has been engaged in a vegetables trade business. He buys vegetables from the nearest villages and resells them in the Ijevan food market in his renting place. With the profit from his business, Vazgen was able to buy a car (which he uses in his business) and furniture for his house. He has received a loan from Nor Horizon 8 times and has never delayed his repayments. 

Vazgen is expecting to increase his income from his vegetable business, so he is seeking a 550,000 Armenian drams loan to add varieties of his vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To add varieties of his vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en:
Qadir is a 54-year-old cattle breeder who breeds cattle and sheep. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his wife and five children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He has 4 years of experience in this field. Cattle and sheep breeding is the only financial income in his family. 

Qadir generates income from selling sheep and cattle for meat purposes and also sheep for their wool.  His profit per month is about 150 AZN. He applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to purchase more sheep and cattle. This will be his 4th loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase 8 sheep and one cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and bread for her business.

loans.name: Hesbon

texts.en:
Hesbon is 34 years old, married, and blessed with a four-year-old child.  He runs a grocery, mainly selling fruits to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years and has employed one person.  He also has a taxi business for more income.
 
Hesbon has managed to grow his business through Faulu Kenya.  His desire is to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He needs 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits.

loans.use: To buy fruits.

loans.name: Qafar

texts.en: Qafar is 43-year-old man who raises and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables. He has 15 years of experience in this field. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar, an Internally Displaced Settlement. He is married and has two children. His wife actively helps him to run the business. Qafar usually sells his crops in the central bazaar. He applied for 1,000 AZN in order to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil and dry meat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell products (oil, flour, rice, broth, soft drinks, etc.).

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 40-year-old business woman. She is widowed with six children. To raise her children, she sells fruits and vegetables in wholesale. She has been in the business for ten years and has employed one person. Being a widow, she works hard in her business in order to provide for her children, including educating her two children who are in school.

Leah hopes to grow her business in the future. She needs 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fruits and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy fruits and potatoes

loans.name: Pureza

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia de mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mae de 2 filhos  um bebe e o outro frenquenta a Escola. Fez o nivel médio e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 3 anos vende produtos de primeira necessidade e consegue um rendimento de cerca 7.500.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.600.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim,feijão, arroz, caldos, refrescos e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial para aumentar o seu rendimento, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is married and has two children - one of them is a baby and the other one attends school. She finished high school and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over three years. She sells essential goods and earns an income of about 7.500mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 25.600mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (peanuts, beans, rice, broths, soft drinks, etc.) in order to increase the amount of her merchandise.
She promises to repay according to the schedule. In the future she plans to expand her retail business in order to increase her income. For that purpose she intends to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (peanuts, beans, rice, broths, soft drinks, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three cows.

loans.name: Niinue Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Niinue Group in Western Kenya! Norah is the facilitator of the Niinue SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Norah is currently taking care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and hire more land for farming. In the recent 2011 season, Norah had an excellent maize yield harvesting 23 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Norah was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Norah  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Norah will buy a cow, ensure food security and invest in business to ensure education for her children.

In 2012, the members of Niinue SHG group are each preparing to plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty products for selling (hair weaves and extensions).

loans.name: Leta

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Moamba, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos um deles ja frenquenta a Escola. Fez a 3ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Moamba para Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida. É negociante ha bastante tempo e vende produtos de primeira necessidade e tem um rendimento de cerca 5.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, peixe, amendoim, sumos, e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 6.000.00mt e foi para o negocio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Leta was born in Moamba District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has two children; one of the children still goes to school. Leta finished third grade but did not continue because her parents had financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Moamba to move to Boane in search of better living conditions. Leta has been a businesswoman for quite some time and sells staple goods. She has an income of about 5,000 meticais which she uses for household expenses, and she saves some in her bank account.

Leta has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Leta's second Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy products (rice, fish, peanuts, juices and other items) to increase her inventory. The first loan was for 6,000 meticais and was for the business.

She promises to make her payments on time, and in the future she plans to expand her business. To do this, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (rice, fish, peanuts, juices, etc.).

loans.name: Anitah

texts.en:
Anitah is a 27-year-old lady who is blessed with one child, a one year old.  She sells cereals to earn a living.  She has been in the business for four years.  She has employed two people to assist her in her task.  She was previously employed as a shopkeeper and managed to open her own business through Faulu Kenya.

Anitah needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais dois ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 12ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 15 anos vende roupa usada e tem um rendimento de cerca 10.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt,com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada, para aumentar a sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negocio construindo um estabelecimento comercial, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Lurdes was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has five children; two of the children still go to school. Lurdes finished 12th grade but did not continue because her parents had financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has been a businesswoman for more than 15 years, selling used clothing. Lurdes has an income of around 10,000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Lurdes' first Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 20,000 meticais so she can buy bundles of used clothing to increase her inventory.

Lurdes promises to make her payments on time. She plans to expand her business in the future by building a store. To do this, she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell used clothing.

loans.name: Kitagata Women Group

texts.en: Perezi is a thirty-eight-year-old widow with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in coffee for one year. She was initially buying coffee in basins and now buys it in sacks. Her hardships are customers not paying on time and seasonal weather. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house. Her business goals are buying land, moving her business to a more permanent location and expanding her business to new markets. Perezi needs the loan facility to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy coffee.

loans.name: Enia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Manhiça, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos todos ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 9ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois enteados que vivem com ela. 

Saiu da Manhiça para o Distrito de Boane quando se juntou ao seu marido, é negociante ha mais de 11 anos vende produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca 3.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um familiar que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, amendoim, sal, oleo e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir um estabelecimento comercial para melhorar o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Enia was born in the District of Manhiça, Province of Maputo, south of Mozambique, is married and the mother of 2 children who both attend School. She completed 9th grade and didn’t continue her education due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own home with her family and supports 2 step-children who live with her.

She left Manhiça for the District of Boane when she joined her husband and has been a trader for more than 11 years. She sells various products and has an income of around 3,000.00 meticals (MZN) which she spends on household expenditure and saves in her bank account (BIM).

Enia has never had loans from other banks and came to know Hluvuku through a family member who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 20,000.00 MZN with which she intends to buy products (rice, peanuts, salt, oil and others) to increase her merchandise.

She commits to paying off the loan and in future intends to build a commercial establishment to improve her business. As such, she intends to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase products for resale (rice, peanuts, salt, oil and others)

loans.name: Amani Shg Group

texts.en:
Peter is the facilitator of Amani SHG group. Peter and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Peter takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Peter had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Peter was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Peter will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Amani SHG group will each plant maize plots on between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Peter is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Benvinda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua irmã enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas dispesas alimentares. 

É negociante ha mais de 11 anos vende produtos de primeira necessidade e tem um rendimento de cerca 6.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimo noutro banco para o negocio e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar produtos (farinha de milho, arroz, amendoim, sal, oleo e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 12.000.00mt e 16.000.00mt ambos aplicados para o negocio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a construção da sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Benvinda was born in the city of Maputo in the Province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She’s single and the mother of 4 children, 3 of whom still attend School. She completed 7th grade and didn’t continue due to her parents’ lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her sister by sending money to aid with food expenses.

She has been a trader for more than 11 years selling essential goods and has a monthly income of around 6,000.00 meticals (MZN) which she spends on household expenditure and saves in her bank account (BIM).

She has had loans from another bank for her business and managed to pay these off without difficulties. She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her third loans with Hluvuku for the amount of 20,000.00 MZN with which she intends to buy products (corn flour, rice, peanuts, salt, oil and others) to increase her merchandise. Her first loans were for 12,000.00 MZN and 16,000.00 MZN, both applied to her business.

She commits to paying off the loan and in future intends to build her house. As such, she intends to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase products for resale (corn flour, rice, peanuts, salt, oil and others)

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Marracuene, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 ainda frenquentam a Escola e o outro é dificiente. Fez a 2º ano da Univercidade Pedagógica e não continuou por falta de tempo.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ela. 

Saiu de Marracuene  para o Distrito de Boane em missão de serviço, é professora ha mais de 25 anos leciona na EPC de Boane e tem um salário de 3.710.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 26.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 12.500.00mt e 12.500.00mt e foi para a obra da sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a construção da sua casa e construir um murro, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Antonieta was born in the district of Marracuene in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of 3 children, 2 of whom go to school, and 1 is disabled.  She finished studying through her second year at the teaching college and didn't continue due to the lack of time. She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her mother, who lives with her. 

She left Marracuene for the district of Boane because of a military assignment.  She has been a teacher for more than 25 years and teaches at the EPC in Boane.  She makes 3,710 meticals a month, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of our institution.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 26,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials to continue working on her home (cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.).  Her first 2 loans were for 12,500 meticals each, and she also put these towards the work on her home.  

She promises to make her payments on time, and in the future, she plans to finish the construction on her home and to build a wall, for which she is planning on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to continue work on her home (cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson, a 43-year-old Ugandan father of four children between the ages of 24 and 8. hails from Kyenjojo District where he has operated a retail shop for four years. He is now requesting a loan to buy fuel, soap and sugar for resale, and dreams of developing his business into a wholesale operation and educating his children.

loans.use: to buy fuel, soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 10ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 3 irmãs e uma sobrinha que vivem com ela. 

É educadora ha mais de 3 anos num Centro Infantil na Matola e tem um salário de 4.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt,com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (barrotes, cimento, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir um recinto e abrir uma Escolinha Infantil pessoal, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Palmira was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has two children who both go to school. Palmira finished tenth grade but did not continue because her parents did not have the money for it. She lives in her own house with her family and also supports three sisters and a niece who live with her.

For more than three years Palmira has been a teacher at a preschool in Matola. She has a salary of 4,500 meticais which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account.

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Palmira's first Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy materials (beams, cement, sand, stone, iron and other items) to continue construction on her house.

Palmira promises to make her payments on time, and one day she intends to build a place and start her own school. To do it she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house (beams, cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 1 filho que frenquenta a Escola. Fez o nivel médio e não continuou por falta de tempo.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os seus pais que vivem com ela. 

É professora ha mais de 12 anos, leciona no Distrito de Boane e tem um salário de 5.640.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja teve emprestimos noutros bancos (BIM) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa (pranchas, barrotes, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros.) para dar continuidade com a obra.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has one child who goes to school. Maria finished teacher education for elementary teachers but did not continue because she did not have enough time. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her parents, who live with her.

She has been a teacher for more than 12 years. She teaches in Boane District and has a salary of 5,640 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Maria has had loans from other banks (BIM), and she was able to pay them back with no problems. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Maria's first Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 20,000 meticais so she can buy materials (planks, beams, sand, stone, iron and other items) to continue construction on her home.

Maria promises to make her payments on time. She plans to finish her house and furnish it one day. To do this, she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction material for her home (planks, beams, sand, stone, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Omulanyi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Omulanyi Group in Western Kenya! Violet is the facilitator of the Omulanyi group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Violet takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices offered by the firm and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Violet had a very good yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Violet was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Violet will educate her children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Omulanyi group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Violet is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Caia,  Provincia de Sofala, Centro  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Nunca teve oportunidade de frequentar a Escola por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para Maputo no Distrito de Boane em missão de serviço, é pensionista militar ha mais de 11 anos e tem uma pensão de 5.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt,com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (cimento, pranchas, barrotes, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de:10.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt ambos para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e melhor confortar a sua familia , para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Helena was born in Caia District, Sofala Province in central Mozambique. She is single and has three children who all attend school. Helena never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents did not have the money for it. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left her hometown to move to Boane District in Maputo on work assignment. For more than 11 years she has received a military pension of 5,500 meticais per month. Helena uses the money for household expenses and also saves some in her bank account.

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Helena's third Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy construction materials for her house (cement, planks, beams, sand, stone, iron and other items). The earlier loans were for 10,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais; both were for housing.

Helena promises to make her payments on time, and she intends to one day finish her house and make her family more comfortable. To do this she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction material for her house (cement, planks, beams, sand, stone, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Twende S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Twende S.H Group in Western Kenya! Margaret is the facilitator of the Twende S.H group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Margaret takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Margaret had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Margaret was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margaret  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Margaret will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Twende S.H group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a young married woman with four children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Her business is selling bananas. She transports them to Kampala for resale.  She started by purchasing ten bunches of bananas but now she purchases a lorry. Her challenge is the high cost of bananas.

Her dream is to educate her children and build a permanent house. Victoria needs the loan to buy bananas for resale.

loans.use: to buy bananas for resale.

loans.name: Linda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais dois frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo no Distrito de Boane ainda pequena na companhia de seus pais, é negociante dedica-se a criação e venda de frangos ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de cerce de 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt,com qual pretende comprar mais pintos, vitamina e ração para aumentar a quantidade de frangos. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, para criação de frangos.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende reabilitar a sua casa e mobiliar , para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Linda was born in the province of the Inhambane in southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children, two of whom are still in school. She went to school through the sixth grade, but had to drop out because of her parents' financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

She and her parents left Inhambane for Maputo in the district of Boane when she was still a child. She's a businesswoman and has been raising and selling chickens for more than 10 years. She earns about 7,000 meticals a month, which she uses for household expenses, as well as saving some in her bank account.
She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she intends to use to buy more roosters, vitamins, and feed to increase the quantity of her stock. Her first loan was in the amount of 10,000 meticals for raising chickens.
She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to fix up her house and furnish it.

loans.use: to buy more roosters, vitamins, and feed for raising chickens.

loans.name: Siisa S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Siisa S.H Group in Western Kenya! Phanice is the facilitator of Siisa S.H. group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Phanice takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Phanice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Phanice was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Phanice  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Phanice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Siisa S.H group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 35-year-old single mother of five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells used clothes and shoes. 

She started her business with capital of 40,000 UGX but now its worth 2,500,000 UGX. Even so, she faces challenges of price fluctuations and inadequate capital to purchase stock.

Jackline's dream is to educate her children and buy a motorcycle. She needs the loan to buy 20 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hair weaves and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wesakulila Group in Western Kenya! Gladys is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Gladys takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Gladys had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Gladys was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gladys and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Gladys will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Gladys is pictured in the photograph with her group. In the picture the field officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bonefance

texts.en:
Bonefance is a 45-year-old married man with four children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He has been growing onions for sale since 1991. He started by producing two sacks of onions but now he produces 15 sacks. 

His challenge is high labor costs and his dream is to diversify his business by growing more vegetables and educating his children.

Bonefance needs the loan to hire land and plant tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to hire land and plant tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a 32-year-old engaged woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She has a pub that she has been operating for the last five years. She started her business with 200,000 shillings and now it's worth 1,000,000. 

Her challenge has been customers not paying on time and inflation. 

Her dream is buying land to grow crops and expanding her business into a bar. Resty needs the loan to buy six crates of beer for sale.

loans.use: to buy six crates of beer for sale.

loans.name: Sibumba A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sibumba A Group in Western Kenya! Julius is the facilitator of Sibumba group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Julius takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Julius had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Julius was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Julius  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Julius will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

Hudson takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. loans.name: Rwibale Trader Group

texts.en:
Bosco wants a loan to buy maize for resale. 

Age 40, he hails from the Kyenjojo district in Uganda and is the father of five children whom he lives with together with their mother in a permanent house.

Having started by farming, and he saved money to start up this business, which has grown over 10 years. 

His dream is to educate his children and he wishes to acquire a motorcycle to ease transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy maize  for resale.

loans.name: Siritanyi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sitirira Group in Western Kenya! Isaac is the facilitator of the Sitirira group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Isaac takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Isaac had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Isaac was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Isaac and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Isaac will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sitirira group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Isaac is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen was born and lives in Geghamavan village in the Sevan area with his wife, daughter and parents. Armen is 26 years old and has been engaged in animal breeding and bee keeping businesses. He keeps cows, pigs, sheep, turkeys and chickens.
 
Armen also produces and sells cement blocks for construction, but his main income is from his farming. Armen’s parents and wife help him to sell meat, milk and honey in their regional markets.
 
Armen has received loans from Nor Horizon three times and has never delayed his repayments.
 
Armen asks from Kiva 1,000,000 AMD loan to increase the number of his bee families.

loans.use: To increase the number of his bee families.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 29 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. Benson has been working hard to manage his tailoring shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Benson has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making clothes for resale. This will help Benson to generate greater profits and buy more cows for his farm. Benson hopes that in the future he will be able to start up another business and also build a house. 

Benson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Benson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night is a 34-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. For the past five years, she has been selling beverages with an initial capital of 400,000 UGX from her mother. Night’s hardship is inadequate capital. Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goals are to buy land, grow crops, and expand her business into new markets. 

Night is requesting a loan to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with two children who attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and also takes care of two additional family members, her sister and her brother. Rose lives in a home she owns and has access to electricity but is without running water. For the past eight years, Rose has run a business selling charcoal. She works six days out of every week and sells her product wholesale at the market. She also earns an income teaching part time. Rose’s main business challenges are transportation and the rainy season. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

Rose is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from MDCT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to transport her goods and also to start selling used clothes.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Wil

texts.en:
Wil is a 30-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For the past year, he has been running a wholesale business selling soda and beer. Wil’s hardships are price fluctuations, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital. 

Will is requesting a loan to buy beer to sell. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. His business goals are to expand into new markets and find a more permanent location.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 48 years old and the father of nine children. He is requesting another loan to buy clothes and bags to sell for the Christmas season. He used his previous loan to buy clothes to sell. Wilson’s challenge is that his limited funds make it difficult to meet the demands of his customers. His dream is to become a wholesale trader.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Llauquen Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Llauquen”, está conformado por 20 emprendedores, quienes se desempeñan en los rubros de preparación de comida costumbrista, venta de ropa y perfumes. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Castro. 
Nilda integrante del banco comunal y quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila del grupo,en el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha,estando de pie, además está usando anteojos y su cabello corto castaño oscuro. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida costumbrista de la zona del sur de Chile. Entre estas preparaciones se encuentran el milcao, chuchoca, empanadas, pan casero y el curanto. Se desempeña en este rubro desde hace 14 años, ocupa su casa para la preparación de esta comida, para esto cuenta con una cocina a gas, una cocina a leña, una extendedora de masa, fuentes, peroles (Recipiente de metal en forma de media esfera y generalmente con dos asas que se usa para cocinar) y ollas. Comenta que su horario es totalmente flexible y que la temporada de más alta demanda es durante el verano, ya que se realizan muchas fiestas costumbristas y ferias. Sus ingredientes los compra generalmente en supermercados, donde los precios sean más convenientes económicamente. Y de esta manera le ha ido muy bien.
El crédito lo invertirá para construir un quincho para ofrecer sus comidas en el mismo lugar para que sus clientes consuman directamente el producto. Además quiere adquirir un horno industrial para sus preparaciones. Ya que Nilda se dedica al Reitimiento consiste en la matanza y posterior cocción de un chancho (cerdo) y otros alimentos en un caldero para obtener manteca.
Ella vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad, quienes le ayudan a promocionar sus comidas y atraer nuevos clientes. Uno de sus sueños es que uno de sus hijos termine de estudiar, ya que así podrá optar a mejores trabajos. Además le gustaría viajar dentro del país para conocer algunos lugares. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, debido a que puede contar con un capital que le permita invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta con mucha alegría y cariño las reuniones del banco comunal, ya que el grupo es muy unido y solidario. 
Castro es capital de la isla de Chiloé (la isla más grande de América del Sur), en la región de Los Lagos, zona sur austral de Chile. Su paisaje natural se conserva casi en su totalidad sin intervención del hombre. Además posee una cultura de gran riqueza mítica y costumbrista. Uno de sus grandes atractivos son sus Palafitos, edificaciones (casas) construidas sobre pilotes de madera en la ribera, sobre el mar.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named Llauquen.  There are 20 entrepreneurs who work in the areas of preparing traditional food and selling clothing and perfume.  All of them live in the city of Castro.

Nilda is a member of the communal bank; in the photo she is in the middle of the group, in the third row from the bottom, wearing glasses.  She works preparing and selling traditional food in the southern part of Chile.  Among these dishes are "milcao" [potato pancakes], "chuchoca" [potato bread], "empanadas" [meat pies], homemade bread, and "curanto" [clambake].  She has been in this business for 14 years, and she uses her home to prepare the food.  She has a gas stove, a wood-burning stove, a dough spreader, pots (metal cooking containers in the shape of a half-sphere and generally with two handles), and pans.

She says that her schedule is totally flexible and that the season of highest demand is during the summer, since there are many traditional festivals and fairs.  Generally she buys her ingredients in the supermarket, where the prices are better, and in this way it has gone very well for her.

She will use the loan to build a "quincho" [thatched barbecue area] to offer her meals in the same place, so her customers eat the food right there.  Nilda also wants to get an industrial oven for her meals, since she also works in rendering, which consists of killing and later cooking a pig and other food in a cauldron to make lard.

She lives with her husband and two children, ages 19 and 17, who help her advertise her meals and attract new customers.  One of her dreams is that one of her children will finish studying, since in that way there would be better job options.  She also would like to travel throughout the country to know some places.

Nilda is very happy and grateful for the services granted by Fondo Esperanza, since she can count on capital that will allow her to invest in her business.  She also enjoys the communal bank meetings with great happiness and affection, since the group is united and supportive.

Castro is the capital of the island of Chiloé (the biggest island in South America), in the region of Los Lagos, in the south of Chile.  The natural landscape is conserved almost totally without human intervention.  It also has a culture rich in myth and tradition.  The "palafitos," structures (houses) built on wood pilings on the shore above the ocean, are one of the greatest attractions there.

loans.use: to build a "quincho" [thatched barbecue area] where her customers can eat their meals and to get an industrial oven.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groundnut seedlings for planting

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia, age 38, owns and operates a retail shop in Kyenjojo district. She has run this business for eight years. She started as a farmer, saved her money, and started the shop with her savings. 

She dreams of growing her business to a wholesale business and seeing her children educated. She is the mother of three children, aged between 10 and 20. 

Sylivia is requesting a loan in order to buy sugar to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar to offer for sale

loans.name: Mathieu

texts.fr:
Mathieu  est né au Rwanda et a 62 ans. Il est marié avec 4 enfants de 13 à 34 ans. Il a une autre personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de secondaire. 
Mathieu est agri éleveur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une vache.
Mathieu voudrait agrandir son activité en achetant d’autres vaches. Il voudrait être le premier   éleveur dans sa région et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mathieu  is 62 years old and was born in Rwanda. He is married and has 4 children, aged from 13 to 34 years old.  Besides his children, he is responsible for one other person. He has received 4 years of secondary education. 

Mathieu is a farmer/breeder. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He wants to use the loan to buy a cow, and then to expand his business by buying more cows. His goal is to become the biggest breeder in the area, and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to weed her maize garden

loans.name: Gidion

texts.en:
Gidion, age 26, is a teacher. He feels that he needs to acquire more skills by going to school to pursue higher education. He is requesting a loan in order to pay for his school fees.

He dreams of eventually getting married and building a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughter and sale at his butcher shop

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.fr:
Vedaste est né au Rwanda et a 55 ans. Il est marié avec 6 enfants de 11 à 24 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de secondaire. 
Vedaste est agri-éleveur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une vache.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business  est d’élever des vaches modernes (des vache qui donner une grande quantité du lait). Il voudrait être le premier éleveur dans sa région et scolariser et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Vedaste was born in Rwanda and is 55 years old. He is married and has six children, 11 to 24 years old. Four of the children are in school. Vedaste has a 4th grade education. He is a farmer and raises livestock. This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. 

Vedaste is going to use his loan to buy a cow. His strategy for the growth of his business is to raise modern cows (which produce a lot of milk). He would like to be the No. 1 livestock farmer in his region, educate his children, and take care of them.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in  Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  Jane has a business of tailoring. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products at the market, retail.

 Jane has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy rolls of clothing materials.  The main business challenges for Jane include transportation and defaulters .  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school and to be a wholesaler.  

 Jane lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To  buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle for slaughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to weed and mulch his banana plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize produce to offer for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt, and other general merchandise to offer for sale

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela has been operating a pharmacy business for the last two years in order to help support her family. She describes herself as a hard-working businesswoman. Thanks to a previous loan through Faulu Kenya, she has managed and improved her business. Previous to starting her own business, she was employed elsewhere. 

Pamela has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She and her husband have two children, both enrolled in school.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy medicines to offer for sale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Pamela also dreams of buying a piece of land in future.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward owns and operates a retail shop. He is the recipient of a previous loan, which allowed him to add a bicycle repair section to his business. Edward feels that this addition to his shop helped him to realize some of his dreams. He has also been able to start building a permanent home for his family.

He is requesting a new loan in order to buy motorcycle spare parts for his shop.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beer, soda and spirits for his bar.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her brothers). 

Florence has a business selling cereals.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Florence sells her products in a shop, retail.  She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of beans, groundnuts and maize. She also generates additional income through owning a cosmetics shop.

The main business challenges for   Florence include transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease transportation of cereals and to be a wholesaler.    Florence lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, beans and groundnuts.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.fr:
Jonas  est né au Rwanda et a 52 ans. Il est marié avec 5 enfants de 4 à 20 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Il a une autre personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de secondaire. 

Jonas est commerçant. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des chaussures destine à vendre. 

Jonas voudrait être un grand commerçant des chaussures de qualité dans  leurs marches locale. Avec le profit  Jonas voudrait  scolariser et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jonas was born in Rwanda and is 52 years old. He is married and has five children aged between 4 and 20. Four of his children attend school. Besides his children, he also take care of another person. He attended secondary school for 4 years. 

Jonas is a businessman. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy shoes that he can sell.

Jonas would like to be a successful merchant of quality shoes in local markets. Jonas will use any profits to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy shoes for retail.

loans.name: Vianus

texts.en:
Vainus is married and a father of six children, aged 21-5, living in his own semi-permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. He has dependents and he is the sole breadwinner of the family. 

For 11 years he has been running a spare parts business and he started as a small-scale farmer. He saved to start his current business. He is faced with a challenge of poor roads and bad debts but despite the challenges he is facing he believes business is doing well.

Vainus needs a loan to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kasekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 3 children. For the past 10 years, Jane has been working hard to manage her wholesale shop, which sells soap, sugar, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap for resale, and will help Jane to generate greater profits she will use buy food to feed her family. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth es secretaria en un periódico de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de un diplomado para secretarias, para así tratar de avanzar en su trabajo. Vive en casa de un familiar la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es soltera y sin hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que Elizabeth solicita que su préstamo sea fondeado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a secretary at a newspaper in the city of La Paz.  She needs the loan to pay for advanced secretarial coursework.  That is how she will try to advance in her work.

She lives in a family member’s house, which is located in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz.  She is single, and she does not have children.

This is the second time that Elizabeth has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for advanced secretarial coursework.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his construction business, which sells timber. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber for resale, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more timber for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.fr:
John  est né au Rwanda et a 45 ans. Il est marié avec 6 enfants de 8 à 20 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de secondaire.

John est commerçant. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’améliorer son commerce des chaussures en détail. 

John voudrait être un grand distributeur des chaussures dans son province. Avec le profit  John voudrait  scolariser et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
John was born in Rwanda and is 45 years old. He is married and has 6 children aged between 8 and 20. Five of his children attend school. He attended secondary school for 4 years. 

John is a businessman. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to improve his footwear retail business. 

John would like to become a successful distributor of footwear in his province. John will use any profits to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: improve his footwear retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer, which will help him a lot in his graphic arts studies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia tiene una pequeña tienda de barrio. El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital y comprar productos como ser: harina, azúcar, dulces, galletas y demás. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona  16 de febrero en la ciudad de El Alto; es divorciada tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que Virginia obtiene un crédito esperando mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y por esta razón se lo trata de fondear a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Virginia has a small neighborhood store.  She needs the loan to increase capital and to buy products like flour, sugar, sweets, cookies, and others.

She rents where she lives in the 16 de Febrero area in the city of El Alto.  She is divorced, and she has one child.

This is Virginia’s first loan, and she is hoping to improve her family’s quality of life.  That is the reason she is trying to get a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, sweets, and cookies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr:
Charles  est né au Rwanda et a 59 ans. Il est marié avec 8 enfants de 9 à 26 ans, dont 7 scolarisés. Il a une autre personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de secondaire. 

Charles est salarie. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une vache. 

Charles voudrait être un grand vendeur de vache et des viandes des vaches dans sa région. Avec le profit  Charles voudrait  scolariser et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Charles was born in Rwanda and is 59 years old. He is married and has 8 children aged between 9 and 26. Seven of his children attend school. Besides his children, he also take care of another person. He attended secondary school for 4 years. 

Charles is a worker who earns a salary. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy a cow.

Charles would like to become a successful merchant of cattle and cattle meat in his region. Charles will use any profits to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La señora Paula es tejedora de mantas y guantes de lana e hilo y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital para comprar lana de diversas texturas y colores y continuar con su pequeño negocio. Vive en casa de su hija la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Villa Progreso de la Ciudad de El Alto. Paula se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que pudo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y ahora trata de mejorar su negocio para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Paula weaves blankets and gloves from wool and yarn, with the assistance of her daughter.  The loan she is requesting is for increasing her capital to purchase wool in different textures and colors, and to continue with her small business.

She lives in her daughter's home, which is located in the Villa Progreso area of the city of El Alto.  

Paula is very satisfied with the loans that are being offered to her, as she will be able to improve her family's quality of life, and try to improve her business by generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase wool in different textures and colors, so as to continue her business weaving blankets and gloves.

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is a farmer from the village Shashiani, East Georgia. He is 70 years old and lives with his wife Emma. Nikoloz and Emma earn their living through agricultural activities. They have children (and grandchildren), who are married and live separately. The family owns agricultural land which is used for maize, strawberry, tomato growing. Also the family has a vineyard on 0.8 hectares of land. Nikoloz and Emma sell harvested products locally in the village. Their total average monthly income is 400 Laris. 

Nikoloz has requested a loan to  purchase fuel for his tractor. Also part of the loan will also be used for purchasing fertilizers. With the increased income Nikoloz and Emma plan to pay high school fees for their grandchild.

loans.use: to purchase fuel  and fertilizers.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es: La señora Magda se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado; también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la localidad donde vive. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de ganado, para criar, procrear y luego vender. Vive en casa en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la localidad de Palomar del departamento de  La Paz; es divorciada tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que Magda obtiene un crédito en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Señora Magda works in agriculture, raising cattle.  She also has a small grocery store in the neighborhood where she lives.  

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of cattle to raise, breed and ultimately sell.

She live in her own home, which is located in the Palomar neighborhood in the department of La Paz.  She is divorced with three children.

This is the first time that Magda has taken a loan from our institution.

loans.use: to purchase two calves to raise and ultimately sell, as this is one of her businesses.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La señora Delia se dedica a la agricultura y ademas tiene una pequeña cantidad de cabezas de ganado lechero; su esposo se dedica al auto transporte. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para incrementar su producción de leche y por ende mejorar los ingresos de la familia. Vive en casa en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la localidad de Palomar del departamento de  La Paz; Delia es casada y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que Delia obtiene un crédito a través de Impro  y de Kiva.
texts.en:
Señora Delia works in agriculture and also has a small number of dairy cows.  Her husband works in car transportation.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of a pair of dairy cows to increase her milk production and therefore improve her family's income.

She lives in her parents' home, which is located in the Palomar neighborhood in the department of La Paz.  Delia is married and does not have children.

This is the first time that Delia is taking out a loan through Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of diary cows to improve her milk production.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 8 children, none of whom is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).  Florence has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Beatrice sells her products from home, by means of retail. Beatrice has requested for  a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Beatrice include ever increasing prices of charcoal and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to build more rental rooms.    Beatrice lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a la venta de artículos como carteras, zapatos, además es empleado de un comercial como vendedor, él está casado, aun no tiene hijos, lleva dos años en el negocio, y 5 años tiene de ser empleado.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como zapatos, controles, baterías, tazas, entre otros productos que ofrece en el negocio, la inversión le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, aumentando la mercadería.
El objetivo de Juan es seguir en su trabajo como empleado, además que su negocio prospere, para mejorar con su familia las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan works as a salesman at a store in town.  He earns an extra income selling wallets, shoes and other merchandise.  He is married and has no children.  He has been a salesman for 5 years and operated his own business for two years.  
He is applying for a loan to shoes, batteries, dishware and other products that he will resell.  The loan will help him to increase his stock and improve his business. 
Juan's goal is to continue working for his employer and grow his business so that he can better support his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his retail business.

loans.name: Twongerumusaruro No 29 / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Marcel fait partie du groupe Twongerumusaruro no 29. Le nom du groupe signifie «Augmentons la production». Il a 43 ans et il est marié avec 12 enfants de 1 à 18 ans, dont 8 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Marcel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire les semences sélectionnée. Dans les prochaines années, Marcel voudrait être le distributeur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marcel is a member of the Twongerumusaruro No. 29 Group. The group's name means "Let's increase production." He is 43 years old, married and has 12 children aged between 1 and 18. Eight of his children attend school. He attended primary school for 6 years. 

Marcel is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer to grow rice.

His business growth strategy is to plant a crop of selected seeds. In the coming years, Marcel would like to become a distributor of rice in his region. He will use any profits to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Mayde

texts.es: La señora Mayde se dedica a la agricultura y además ayuda a sus padres con la producción de leche. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras de mediana calidad para  así incursionar en el rubro lechero para mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la localidad de Palomar del departamento de  La Paz; es casada no tiene hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de una institución financiera y al explicarle las ventajas de fondeo a través de Kiva, ella decidió usar esta vía para financiar su crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Mayde works in agriculture, and also helps out her parents with milk production.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of a pair of dairy cows of decent quality so that she can venture into the dairy sector herself to improve her income.

She lives in her parents' home, which is located in the Palomar neighborhood in the department of La Paz.  She is married and does not have children.

This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from a financial institution, and once she heard about the advantages of being funded through Kiva, she decided to use this path for financing her loan.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of dairy cows so she can venture into the field of milk production and sales.

loans.name: Jose Valentin

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, él es comerciante de mariscos al mayoreo, este negocio es de familia, lleva 5 años realizándolo por su propia cuenta, logrando mantenerse y de las ventas poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mariscos variados, pescado fresco de varias clases, curvina, guapote, boca roja, sardina, entre otras clases, para ofrecer al mayoreo, esta inversión le ayudara bastante para abastecer a los clientes que le comprar los productos.
La aspiración de José es comprar mariscos frescos, para agradar a los clientes, manteniendo su preferencia, así también velar por las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and three children.  He operates a wholesale seafood business.  It's a family business and he has been running it on his own for 5 years now.  He makes enough from the business to support his family.  
Jose is applying for a loan to buy seafood--fresh fish such as corvina, guapote, boca roja, sardines, etc.--that he will resell to commercial buyers.  This loan will allow him to stock the business with the products that his customers want.  
Jose's goals are to: stock his business with fresh fish, satisfy the demand from his customers and provide for his children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his fish-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shirts, dresses and children's clothes

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La señora Blanca, se dedica a la agricultura; tiene ganado lechero y con la venta de leche genera ingresos para la familia; además, tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de dos vacas lecheras de mediana calidad para incrementar el volumen de leche para su venta y mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la localidad de Palomar del departamento de  La Paz: es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que Blanca obtiene un crédito esperando mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca engages in agriculture. She has dairy cattle and sells the milk in order to generate income for her family. In addition, she manages a small store that sells basic necessities. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy two dairy cows of moderate quality so that she can increase the volume of milk that she sells and generate more income. Blanca lives in her own home in the town of Palomar in the Department of La Paz. She is married and has one child.

This is the first time Blanca has obtained a loan. She hopes to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Florencia; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha y tambien vende jora que es un insumo que se usa para preparar la chicha,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de chicha . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche y fideos al por mayor y tambien para comprar jora para preprara la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
